messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] feeling "dull"
messages.msgSnippet: ... I don t think any of us are born dull.  I think we re born full of curiousity and wonder. However, life experiences, especially the enforced drudgery of
messages.messageBody:
>
>
> > Now that I am convinced that I am dull and concerned about the well
> > being of my children, is there any real harm in *structuring* time
> to
> > play games from the "Family Math" book, do science experiments,
> watch
> > movies for "history" and "science", do vocabulary cartoon books and
> > word puzzle books.

I don't think any of us are born dull. I think we're born full of
curiousity and wonder.

However, life experiences, especially the enforced drudgery of school,
can do a lot to dull that edge.

Maybe an important part of figuring out how to get "sharp" is examining
the things that took the edge off and the luster out in the first place.

Best wishes,
Betsy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
